review_text:
You will find this little basement unit to be exactly as advertised but you may be surprised at just how detail oriented these hosts are. This is a small space but it feels much larger. The decor is clean and completely unintrusive to the space. This is a big deal and it seems like the other properties I have been in lately have covered every inch of counter, table, wall and floor space with junk. This is definitely not like that and what a breath of fresh air.
One frustrating thing I find when I travel is lack of accessible outlets. This little basement is loaded with USB-A and standard electrical outlets. You will find them all over. The night tables have them built in so no need to get behind the bed or move furniture to plug in your electronics.
The wifi works well and I was able to stream with no problem. The bathroom has shampoo, conditioner and body gel dispensers. The kitchen has a small coffee maker complete with coffee, filters and yummy biscotti.
There is a bar top seating area with two chairs that serves as a table for eating or a place to work if you need office space. There are canned lights throughout the unit that provide lots of light so you don't feel like you are in a basement cave.
The unit is right around the corner from a beautiful little park that was very welcomed since my husband and I were traveling with our four-legged friend. I initially chose this because of its close proximity to the downtown area. It was 0.2 miles to get to main street and get a bite to eat at one of the local restaurants.
The listing mentions that this is owned by a husband and wife that like to travel. You can tell that they have picked the best of their stays and put it into their unit.
If you are looking for a huge house then this won't be for you but if you need a convenient, clean and well thought out place to spend a little time then this is a great choice.
